info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 4:48PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL SANTA FE COUNTY THROUGH 515 PM MDT... At 448 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of La Cienega, or 9 miles west of Santa Fe, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Santa Fe, White Rock, Eldorado At Santa Fe, Canada De Los Alamos, Lamy, La Cienega, Hyde Memorial State Park, Tesuque, and Agua Fria. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 272 and 294. Highway 285 between Mile Markers 282 and 290. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.
